member.summary: Computes degree centrality for all nodes.
member.returns: Dictionary of node and its degree centrality.

member.summary: Computes degree centrality for one node.
member.returns: Returns node's degree centrality.

member.summary: Computes in-degree centrality for all nodes.
member.returns: Dictionary of node and its in-degree centrality.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Centrality.DegreeInCentrality(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes in-degree centrality for one node.
member.returns: Returns node's in-degree centrality.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Centrality.DegreeOutCentrality(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Computes out-degree centrality for all nodes.
member.returns: Dictionary of node and its out-degree centrality.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Centrality.DegreeOutCentrality(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes out-degree centrality for one node.
member.returns: Returns node's out-degree centrality.

member.summary: Betweeness centrality.

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.Clustering
member.summary: Clustering

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Clustering.Triangles(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Compute the number of triangles. Finds the number of triangles that include a node as one vertex.
member.param: A List of nodes, optional. Compute triangles for nodes in this container.
member.returns: Number of triangles keyed by node label.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Clustering.ClusteringCoefficient(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Compute the clustering coefficient for nodes. Implemented only for unweighted and undirected graphs.
member.returns: Dictionary of clustering coefficients at specified nodes.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Clustering.AverageClustering(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compute the average clustering coefficient for the graph G. The clustering coefficient for the graph is the average.
member.param: If False include only the nodes with nonzero clustering in the average.
member.returns: Double: Avergae clustering.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Clustering.GeneralizedDegree(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Compute the generalized degree for nodes. For each node, the generalized degree shows how many edges of given triangle multiplicity the node is connected to.The triangle multiplicity of an edge is the number of triangles an edge participates in.
member.returns: Generalized degree of specified nodes. The Counter is keyed by edge triangle multiplicity.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Clustering.TrianglesAndDegreeIter(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: This double counts triangles so you may want to divide by 2. See degree(), triangles() and generalized_degree() for definitions and details.
member.returns: Return an iterator of (node, degree, triangles, generalized degree).

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.Component
member.summary: Component

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.IsConnected(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Returns True if the graph is connected, false otherwise.
member.returns: True if the graph is connected, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.NumberConectedComponents(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Returns the number of connected components.
member.returns: Number of connected components.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.ConnectedComponents(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Generate connected components.
member.returns: Yields sets of nodes, one for each component of graph.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.NodeConnectedComponent(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the set of nodes in the component of graph containing node n.
member.returns: A set of nodes in the component of G containing node n.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.WeaklyConnectedComponents(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Generate weakly connected components of graph.
member.returns: Yields sets of nodes, one for each weakly connected component of G.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.IsWeaklyConnected(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Test directed graph for weak connectivity. A directed graph is weakly connected if and only if the graph is connected when the direction of the edge between nodes is ignored. Note that if a graph is strongly connected, it is by definition weakly connected as well.
member.returns: True if the graph is weakly connected, False otherwise.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.NumberWeaklyConectedComponents(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Returns the number of weakly connected components in graph.
member.returns: Number of weakly connected components.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.StronglyConnectedComponents(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Generate nodes in strongly connected components of graph.
member.returns: Yields sets of nodes, one for each strongly connected component of G.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Component.FastBfs(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: A fast BFS node generator.
member.returns: BFS nodes.

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.Community
member.summary: Community

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Community.GirwanNewman(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Finds communities in a graph using the Girvan–Newman method.
member.returns: Yields tuples of sets of nodes in G. Each set of nodes is a community, each tuple is a sequence of communities at a particular level of the algorithm.
member.note: The Girvan–Newman algorithm detects communities by progressively removing edges from the original graph.The algorithm removes the "most valuable" edge, traditionally the edge with the highest betweenness centrality, at each step.As the graph breaks down into pieces, the tightly knit community structure is exposed and the result can be depicted as a dendrogram.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Community.LFRBenchmarkGraph(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the LFR benchmark graph.
member.returns: The LFR benchmark graph generated according to the specified parameters

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.Cycles
member.summary: Cycles

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Cycles.CycleBasis(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary:
Returns a list of cycles which form a basis for cycles of G.
A basis for cycles of a network is a minimal collection of cycles such that any cycle in the network can be written as a sum of cycles in the basis.Here summation of cycles is defined as "exclusive or" of the edges.Cycle bases are useful, e.g.when deriving equations for electric circuits using Kirchhoff's Laws.
member.returns: A list of cycle lists. Each cycle list is a list of nodes which forms a cycle(loop) in G.

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures
member.summary: Distance measures

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.EffectiveDiameter(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the effective diameter of the graph G. The diameter is the maximum eccentricity.
member.returns: Returns integer the diameter of the graph G.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.Radius(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Returns the radius of the graph G. The radius is the minimum eccentricity.
member.returns: Integer radius of graph.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.Center(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Returns the center of the graph G. The center is the set of nodes with eccentricity equal to radius.
member.returns: List of nodes in center.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.Periphery(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Returns the periphery of the graph G.The periphery is the set of nodes with eccentricity equal to the diameter.
member.returns: List of nodes in periphery

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.UndirectedDistances(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: UndirectedDistances is a supporting function used by Diameter

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.Eccentricity(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph)
member.summary: Eccentricity

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.DistanceMeasures.SingleSourceShortestPath(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compute the shortest path lengths from source to all reachable nodes.
member.returns: Dict keyed by node to shortest path length to source.

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.GraphGenerators
member.summary: Graph generators

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.GraphGenerators.CompleteGraph(System.Int32,GraphLibrary.Graphs.GraphTypes)
member.summary: Returns complete graph. Each node is connected to each other node.
member.param: Number of nodes in generated graph. Higher than 0.
member.returns: A complete graph with specified number of nodes.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.GraphGenerators.ErdosRenyiGraph(System.Int32,System.Double,GraphLibrary.Graphs.GraphTypes)
member.summary: Creates Erdos-Renyi graph.
member.param: Number of nodes in generated graph. Higher than 0.
Probability of the edge between two nodes. Value between 0 and 1.
member.returns: A ErdosReny graph.

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.GraphGenerators.PreferentialAttachmentModel(System.Int32,System.Int32,GraphLibrary.Graphs.GraphTypes)
member.summary: Generates a graph using the preferential attachment model.
member.param: Number of nodes in generated graph. Higher than 0.
member.returns: A generated preferential attachment graph.

member.name: T:GraphLibrary.Traversal

member.name: M:GraphLibrary.Traversal.BreadthFirstSearchAll(GraphLibrary.Graphs.BaseGraph,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns all nodes with distance from nodeSource and predecesor based on Breadth first search.
member.param: Node from where the BFS algorithm starts.
Up to which depth (distance) the nodes are returned.
member.returns: Returns nodes with distances and it's predecesor.

member.param: Node from where the BFS algorithm starts.
Up to which depth (distance) the nodes are returned.
member.returns: Yields Tuple of nodes, distance and it's predecesor.

member.param: Node from where the DFS algorithm starts.

member.returns: Returns nodes with distances and it's predecesor.
